Name: Taipei
Description: The capital and largest city of Taiwan, known for its modern architecture, vibrant cultural scene, and the famous Taipei 101 skyscraper.

Name: Kaohsiung
Description: A major port city in southern Taiwan, known for its bustling harbor, modern infrastructure, and lively arts scene.

Name: Taichung
Description: A central city in Taiwan, known for its parks, museums, and strong cultural heritage, it is the third-largest city in Taiwan.

Name: Tainan
Description: The oldest city in Taiwan, rich in history and culture, with many historic temples, forts, and monuments.

Name: Keelung
Description: A port city in northern Taiwan, known for its fishing industry, scenic harbor, and coastal parks.

Name: Hsinchu
Description: A city known as Taiwan s Silicon Valley, Hsinchu is home to many high-tech companies and a prominent research and development hub.

Name: Chiayi
Description: A city in southern Taiwan, known for its agricultural products, scenic parks, and proximity to famous tourist sites like Alishan.

Name: Miaoli
Description: Located in the western part of Taiwan, Miaoli is known for its rural landscapes, indigenous cultures, and scenic mountain views.

Name: Pingtung
Description: A southern region in Taiwan, known for its agricultural products, beaches, and the Kenting National Park.

Name: Yilan
Description: A county in northeastern Taiwan, known for its natural hot springs, scenic coastlines, and the famous Taroko Gorge.
